values: Endorphins run high after a fight. Her blood sings along with the whistling of the wind through the canyons of steel and stone. Swinging through the night air, her knuckles pleasantly sore, a faint stinging in her ribs from a lucky punch, she can almost understand poetry, the temptation to string together beautiful words, the better to describe the sense of serenity and peace she can only find in the most unique of places. It shoudl disturb her, she knows this. Normal girls, whatever those are, don't do what she's doing. A normal girl her age would be tucked away safely in bed, thoughts filling her head of her boyfriend, or girlfriend, wondering what new movie they'd be going to not-watch while they explored each other physically in the back row. Normal wants and needs for normal boys and girls: Shoes, sex, the things they were told that they couldn't do. Not Cassandra Cain. She wanted to hear the night fly by her ears, whistling as it passed, in a way not many others could ever hear. She had cause to wonder what it was that made her different, deciding it had to be the influence of that rotten tooth of a man who'd sired her, and then those thoughts were gone again, borne away on the wind by a laugh as her stomach dropped out, and she dove thirty feet before snagging a grotesque's outstretched concrete wing with her jump-line, and swinging just above the lightpoles along this street rushing by below.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/13343.html

She cuts through the night like an arrow, fast and silent, disturbing naught but air with her passage. He is gone. Gone. Oracle says they'll get him back from this other place he's been dragged away to. That this army, these evil men, will not be allowed to be the death of the Batman. She doesn't know. Doesn't understand why she isn't allowed to go, to help. Fear isn't an issue. She fears no one. After she was told, informed that the rescue was already being planned, she was gone, away from the monitor, and out into the night. Needed to be away, to be active, to be doing something. Anything is better than waiting to hear that a member of your family is dead.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/12917.html

Words.

Words for this, words for that.  

Everything has a word for it.  

Sometimes, too many words.  The letters are a struggle, even now.  Most signs, she still identifies by their shape.  Oracle's been patient in her attempts to help, but the reading is difficult.  She gets discouraged easily.

Even now, it afects her memories.  They have texture, but lack tone.  The words he spoke meant nothing then, they mean as much now, greyed out by the fog of time.  They sit, just out of reach, and it frustrates her to the point of silent tears in the night.  

Others have clear memories of their childhoods.  Hers are based around a person's stance, what their shoulders and hips did, the positions of their hands.

It seems so incomplete.

There are times she wishes that her speech centers had never been brought up to equal speed with everyone else's.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/12744.html

Tracking David Cain would be like finding a needle in a hayfield. But she had to try. Too much time, too many things drifting along under the surface could lessen her effectiveness in her role. But the detective work, that part of the job that came hand-in-hand with the cape and the cowl was so frustrating. She swept the stacks of papers, of police reports, of witness reports from the table in her Batcave with an aggrivated groan and a sweep of one arm. Clipboard clattered on the sheetrock as they hit the wall and tumbled to the floor. "The League of Assassins," she said to herself. "There's a starting point." She spun, cloak rippling with the movement. "Computer. Access: League of Assassins. All information, all members, guild heads. Known whereabouts, aliases, bases of operations. Give me everything." Working. "Not the Demon. The Demon's Daughter." Understood. Accessing datafile: Talia Al Ghul. "Read to me. Tell me about LexCorp Tower. All potential entrances."
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/12487.html

Acrobats. These two should be Nightwing's problem. But he's got a baby, and a wife. Two things Cassandra doesn't have. So, when a report comes over the wire of two identically dressed acrobats robbing the penthouse of the Cathcart Towers, she takes it. She's been training on her new motorcycle. Twelve minutes, fourteen seconds from her cave to the Towers. A verbal command locks the tires of the bike and engages the bolt-thrower hidden in the ignition system. Anyone trying to boost the bike gets a nasty surprise. The twins in the yellow costumes are faster than she is. More used to using their surroundings as both weapon and obstacle course. But she can anticipate some of their moves. The sets of their shoulders, the position of their feet signalling subtly their intention to leap this way or that. A pivot-turn-kick, and one of the brightly-clad twins is kicked just as she leaps, sending her crashing into a wall, leading with her chin. The other curses in a language Cassandra does not understand, and dives at her, the thought of escape driven away by the picture of her sister being knocked unconscious. "Stupid," Cassandra says quietly, blocking every clumsy blow. These girls are good at the flipping and dodging, not so much at the fighting. Sixty seconds later, the cold night wind ripples Cassandra's cape as she binds the wrists of the two girls. "O. Bad girls. Caught them," she says into her wrist-mic, catching her breath.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/12100.html

"Could contaminate the area. Can't visit him. Not sure if the fear gas has processed it's way through system." Cassandra lashes out at the heavy bag furiously, a barrage of kicks, hammer-punches, backfists, and a headbutt hard enough to make her see stars for a moment. "Stupid. So very stupid." She stands in front of the bag, breathing heavily, trying to find her center again. "He could die. Still." All she can think about is her true father, the man who gave her body it's voice, it's language of violence, out there somewhere, while the best man she's ever known lies in bed, hurt. Her shoulders slump, and she eases to the floor, in a graceless heap, head bowed. She's never felt quite so helpless.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/11831.html

[continued from here] The hand on her shoulder sets an already frazzled Cassandra teetering on the edge. She spins, hands coming up poised to block an incoming blow. Her eyes widen beneath the cowl, one hand glancing off Robin's forearm. Thank God, she thinks, the could of panic receding for a moment, before coming back, harder. She whirls again, kicking Scarecrow, wanting to make certain he's down and staying there...
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/11543.html

All work and no play makes Batgirl a dull girl. That's the lesson that's been drummed repeatedly into her head by her good friend Selina, when she's had the time to see her. Hasn't been frequently. So, with no major escaped lunatics on the docket these days, she's picked out something nice, hoping to impress Rob--, no. Tim. Not Robin. Not without the mask. At home, he's Tim. At his house, she'll be Cassandra, not Batgirl. It's easy enough, after all. Take away the mask and the costume. Put her on a cross-town bus, to go and visit the Drake household. She finds herself shy, disappearing into the jeans and tee-shirt she's wearing for the trip. Walking with her shoulders ever-so-slightly hunched. Is this what it's like for him every time he takes off his face to become Bruce Wayne? How does he stand it? The bus lets her off in their neighborhood. She walks the rest of the way, stopping to pick a single flower from a rosebush, mindful of the thorns. [Open to Dana Drake, and Robin>]
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/11378.html

Tim is home from one of his frequent trips to California.  That always makes her happy.  There's something about the way he smiles at her, something that lightens Cassandra's steps.  Makes her feel like singing, even though she only knows the words to a very few songs.

Tonight isn't a singing night.  The Scarecrow is still on the loose, after all.  

Business needs attending to.

Why is it that Cassandra can only think about getting a new dress for the next time she sees Tim...?

Surveillance.  Right.  Mind on mission.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/11204.html

Birds. Hate birds. Be disenfecting scratches till morning. Let him...let them get the drop on me. Stupid. Foolish. He won't be happy if he sees me like this. Fix it. By myself. Get back on the street. Nothing happened. Nothing.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/10829.html
Her father has been taken. He will not be harmed. I won't allow it. If anyone knows where he is...The Penguin will know.. ...and he will tell me.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/10623.html

Stupid. Stupid. Didn't bind the feet. Just the hands. Should've bound the feet to the hands. Lucky he didn't kill me. Swept my feet, knocked my head on the edge of the roof. Robin arriving was the only thing that kept me from being dead. Like Stephanie.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/10321.html
Batgirl online, secure channel. Apprehended a costumed man who isn't familiar to me. ...he wasn't very far from the home of Huntress. Please advise.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/10102.html

She watches from a rooftop as they load the truck, nervously bantering. They fear the Bat, but not enough to keep them from committing crime, not enough to protect the poor security guard who lies crumpled on the loading dock, hand trying to keep the coil of intestine inside his body. She shakes her head in anger, and vaults, swinging off a fire escape's cold metal railing, the cape catching the air, and popping, drawing the attention of one of them, moments before her boot catches his shoulder, snapping his collarbone. She lands in a crouch, eyeing the two closest. One wrestles with his gun, trying to clear the waistband of his jeans. The other drops into a sloppy fighting stance. His form sucks. She ignores the gunman for the moment. He is not a danger. A flick of her wrist sends a dart at the fourth, pinning his knifehand to his thigh. He screams, but she doesn't hear, too intent on the fighter. She blocks a knife-hand with her forearm. The heel of her hand thumps against his temple, dropping him instantly. His head will ache for the next two days. A back kick sends the gun, finally liberated from it's cloth confinement, skittering across the blacktop. The man who pulled it stands there, looking at his empty hand as though willing the gun back into it. She kicks his knees from under him, hands planted on the pavement, and rolls backward into a handstand, heels cracking the underside of his jaw sharp enough to close his eyes. Another jump, and she's at the side of the wounded security guard, hand pressing firmly above his wound. "An ambulance will be here in a moment. Stay awake."
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/9754.html

She dreams of fire now. Since she and Robin walked into the building to save those that they could, fire licking every surface as though it were a living, breathing thing, all her dreams are filled with flames. She had no fears, before. Would gladly walk into a burning building, face a group of armed men, climb a mountain with only her bare hands. The girl they saved. The only living person in the conflagration. Her face appears in these dreams as well. When she sleeps, it plays out differently. She doesn't save the girl. Doesn't save Robin. The fire eats them both alive, before coming for her. The cape catches first, and then her hair, searing the cowl to her head. She wakes up trembling every time.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/9727.html

Batgirl responding to emergency sirens on GSU campus, investigating explosion in science building.

Will report in once on-site.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/9271.html

Cassandra steps up slowly, as though she's afraid that someone will tell her to get away from there, that she's got no right to be standing at Stephanie's final resting place. She stops at the foot of the plot, the wind and light rain stirring her hair gently. She kneels, placing the single rose she carries at the foot of the marker, and runs her fingers reverently over the carved letters of Stephanie's birth and death. "You were taken too young," she says softly, eyes misting with tears. She does not fight them, her tears for her dead friend. She lets them come easily, and quietly, her shoulders shaking faintly. "I miss you," she manages sadly. She sits there for quite some time, alone with Stephanie. She talks to her, as though Stephanie were able to answer. For Cassandra, maybe in some fashion she does, because the faint trill of laughter can be heard over the wind for a moment or two as she catches her friend up with everything that's been happening since she has gone away.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/8983.html

It will never be enough, will it? No matter how many of Roland Desmond's men, no matter how many of the freaks of this city, no matter how many thieves and madmen and thugs and criminals that we defeat in one night or a thousand of them, it will never be enough, will it? Stephanie died. There isn't any way to ever make that right. I have exhausted myself trying to atone for the part that I played in pushing her and Robin apart. The part that I played in her death. The fault was not mine. The fault was no one's, excepting Roland Desmond. I know this now. I need sleep. The world will look much less confusing after I have slept.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/8828.html

Run. Run faster. Leap, tuck the knees, and fire the grapnel. Caught! The air is cold. Winter. Perhaps think about insulating the costume a bit better. Think about anything but Stephanie, lying cold and dead someplace, going off to fight alone because I stole her boyfriend. "The mind must be clear before battle, Cassandra," Father had once said. "Anger, hurt, confusion, love...none of these have a place on the battlefield. They will all confuse you, weaken your form. You are a weapon incarnate. Hold that keen edge. Never dull." Never dull. The air carries the sounds of gunfire to me. My lips peel back in a savage grin of glee beneath the cowl. Someone to fight. Something to hurt. To project this helpless rage at the death of Stephanie onto. I pity the person holding the gun for a distant moment as I stop, one hand gripping the clawed foot of a gargoyle, toes perched on the ledge, head tilted, trying to gauge direction, distance. There. I can hear him running. Feet splashing in the muck and slush on the snowy street. Two streets down, and coming this way. The cold metal of the fire escape one level beneath bleeds through the soles of my boots. It must be below zero, with this wind. My hands grip the railing, and I lever myself into a perfect handstand, holding it, waiting. I do not hear myself begin to growl with barely supressed anger, until I pivot, and drop, landing on the man's shoulders as he runs beneath, crumpling him to the ground like an empty packet of cigarettes. Both of his collarbones give upon impact. He whimpers something, but I do not listen. I kick his gun into the trash in the alley, where it will lay, forgotten, until someone picks it up in the morning. I bring the broken criminal to his feet with a hand on his belt and a hand in his hair. "Who did you kill?" I hiss, furious, half-blind with rage, and the need to strike out. "Whose life did you end tonight, and why shouldn't I end yours?" My hands are claws, ready to tear his throat out, cocked and waiting...
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/8499.html

Stephanie is dead. Stephanie is dead, and no one told me. I had to discover it on my own, reading mission reports in the computer. Tim must feel terribly like it is his fault. I have to tell him that it can't be his fault. It's obviously mine. If I had not been concerned with taking her boyfriend for my own, he would have been able to protect her. I'm responsible. Not him.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/8389.html

Uh-oh. This could be bad. This morning, after leaving my home-cave, I went to the library again. I have plenty of time to read, with my head still not medically cleared for returning to my costume. I picked up the collected works of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, at His recommendation... And, on the return trip home, I witnessed an assault. I know that I'm not supposed to intervene when I'm not in uniform, but I could hardly let a woman be attacked by three men. I struck as quickly as I could, disarming them with a minimum of violence...but a picture was taken. I heard the shutter, and saw the flash. I'm very much hoping that my face does not end up in the newspaper. It would be all too easy for someone to connect me with Batgirl.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/7986.html

Tim and I had a date. A date. We watched a movie together, and he bought me popcorn, and we shared a soda and a bottle of water and we held hands on the way out of the theater. It's all very exciting. He's wonderful, and smart and very sweet to be as concerned about me as he's been. I very much don't want him to realize that I'm breaking doctor's orders to go out and work out on the street. Not in costume, I'm not going to be Batgirl until he says that I'm ready again. But I need to keep in shape, so that my time off to recover does not cost me when I'm back in the uniform. There's only so much that working out in costume in the cave can accomplish.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/7935.html

I am forbidden from my costume, or from the streets.

I am forbidden from my costume, or from the streets.

I am forbidden from my costume, or from the streets.

I must repeat this, again and again and again, lest I disobey Dr. Thompkins and Alfred and Tim, and take to the streets anyway to beat the person who forced a seizure on Barbara.

I am forbidden from my costumew, or from the streets.

I am forbidden from my costume, or from the streets.

I am forbidden...
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/7424.html

Alfred took me shopping. I'm still waiting for my head to heal up. I stopped taking Dr. Thompkins' painkillers, though. They made my head too muddy. I should call Selina. I think she may be upset with me, for fighting Shiva. But I had no choice. I couldn't let her hurt Tim, could I?
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/7355.html

Dr. Leslie had to operate on my head. ...I'm still not sure how I feel about that. I'm very glad that Tim was there. I was scared, and having him with me made it less frightening. Not sure how, exactly...I mean, it wasn't his head getting cut open...but it was a little easier to let her put that cup over my face, and trust that everything would be ok when I woke up. I haven't been able to do anything, though. Dr. Leslie will barely let me out of bed. It's frustrating. And the back of my head hurts. Behind my ear, where she cut me and stitched me shut. It hurts, and I don't want to be bound here unable to be me and it's confusing... ...but there are flowers. From Tim. They make everything a little less frustrating, when I look at them. Now, I just have to figure out how to tell Him that I can't be on the streets until my head is all healed.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/6951.html

*poke* "Hey...you ok?" Everything's spinning and I can't see and I think I threw up in my mask and... "Batgirl, right? I mean...yeah, ev'rybody says you an' the Bat don't exist, but I know y' do. Durin' the quake, the Bat an' that kid in the red an' yellow, they saved me an' my dawg when the shelter fell in. 'Course, it didn't fall all th' way, but they got me out, jus' like they would anybody. They don' care if yew got a house t' go to or not. They're good people." Something warm and wet and it's licking me and I feel fur and the world won't stop spinning and oh God... "Hey now, Thunder...leave th' Batgirl 'lone. She ain't feelin' so good. Lemme get you on yer feet, li'l gal...is there somebody we c'n call t' help yew out?" "M-my belt...third p-puh-pocket. Radio." *over the comm system* "H'lo...? Hey, um. I'm over off'n Rogers an' Crandall, an' I got Batgirl here. She...I think she's real sick. H'llo? Anybody there?"
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/6836.html

One foot in front of the other. "Computer, record progress report, Harvey Dent case. At termination of recording, forward digital copies to Batman and Oracle." Head's all spinny. Slow. Slow and steady wins the race. "Harvey Dent still unaccounted for. Transmitters applied to telephone at Gilda Gold-Dent's home, no calls from Harvey Dent. Micro-cam installed at the grave of Paul Sloane, the second Two-Face. No hits. Also no hits at the grave of Anthony Maroni, or the home of Detective Renee Montoya. Spent yesterday tailing Crispus Allen, partner of Montoya, found no hint that he was even remotely involved in Dent case. Possibly consult with out of town sources, to see if Harvey Dent has appeared somewhere else?" Sit down. Breathe. Pain, dizziness. Discomfort that can be screened out. Like Daddy said, it's all in your mind. "Leaving for patrol momentarily. Want to stop by and see Selina, see if she has suggestions I may have missed. Will check in before midnight, as I know Alfred is more worried than he should be. Batgirl out."
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/6594.html

I cannot lie in my bed, watching the room spin around me forever. I have work. Luckily, Alfred cannot be here to mother me constantly. He has other obligations. *eases herself out of bed, waiting until the room stops spinning and tumbling, one hand pressed to her stomach, and slowly draws her working clothes on*
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/6219.html

The battle with Shiva was over. Tim brought me home. My head was still ringing after taking Shiva's last shot in the ear. It hurt. It hurt worse than almost anything shy of being shot. When we got into the cave, I was so dizzy I could barely stand. I didn't tell Tim that, of course...no need in him worrying further. It was almost impossible to sleep. The room kept spinning, over and over and over. I think I vomited in the bed. Something is wrong with me, and I don't know what. I'm fine when I'm on my feet...but when I'm not... Did she kill me, and I just don't know it yet?
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/6011.html

No sign of Harvey Dent on regular patrol routes. As per Robin's advice, have added the home of Detective Renee Montoya to the patrol route. Have been informed of Dent's fascination with her. No sign of him there yet, either. He may not strike this month. The only date that fits his operational profile in the computers would be 9/18, with his fascination for the number 2...attempting to find him before then may prove to be impossible.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/5725.html

**recording** Confronted Shiva. Combat did not happen. She wants to make an offer to Redbird to carry on her legacy, to become her student. She has promised no harm will come to him. I will take her at her word. If harm does come to him, it will be on my head, and he will be avenged. Harshly. Answered call to Arkham Asylum, report follows: Explosion in violent prisoner's block. Eyewitness accounts collected from two guards, one doctor, and Professor Jonathan Crane. Most reliable report seems to be from Professor Crane, involving what was apparently a 7 foot reproduction of the Joker, weilding a machine gun, and singing what was apparently a song by someone named "Steve Miller", whoever that is. Two casualties on-site: Cornelius Stirk, the cannibal killer from last year, and Robert Murphy, a member of Asylum security. Examined bodies. Although they were purportedly shot by the giant-Joker, there was no evidence of bullet wounds. They may have, in fact, died from fright. Worst news: There has been an escape from the Asylum in the confusion. Harvey Dent is on the street again. Will begin to look for him at nightfall tomorrow. **end recording**
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/5590.html

I was on my way back to my cave. Oracle called. Shiva. The most dangerous foe I've ever faced. The last time I fought her, she almost killed me. We almost killed each other. I'm not afraid. I'm not. There's a difference between caution, respect...and fear. I am not afraid. She will not touch Robin I'll break both of her legs first.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/5323.html

Borrowed from <lj user=femme_du_chat>:

Ask me three questions.  I promise to answer honestly.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/4882.html

I don't know if I like these shoes. *wiggles her freshly painted toes* They leave my feet too unprotected. But Selina said they were very fashionable for girls in my age group right now. She also said I acted like I was thirty years older than I am. Do I? Am I a stick in the mud? I did very much like the ice cream. I've had ice cream before, with Barbara, but I didn't have sprinkles and nuts and a cherry. I like caramel topping. Probably more than I should. My jeans feel a little tighter today, but that's got to be my imagination.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/4813.html

Oracle has moved to Bludhaven. I miss her already. I am trying to keep my mind on work. There is the explosion to investigate. But it is too quiet in the cave, and my best friend is not here to go to when the quiet becomes too much.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/4498.html

I met the strangest boy. Alfred has been insisting I spend more time in the world, and less in the cave by myself. So, I went to one of Oracle's favorite places. The library. I checked out the collected works of Arthur Conan Doyle. I like mysteries. And becoming better at solving them will help in our work. He suggested I try Sherlock Holmes, so I am. As I was leaving, a young boy was being picked on by bigger boys. I was going to intervene, and another person did. He looked maybe a year younger than Robin, with red hair, and a thinner face. He moved like a fighter, and used a short staff, almost an escrim stick. No lasting damage, no difficult strikes...but he seemed to know the basics well. We talked. His name is Lonnie. He bought me an ice cream soda. He was really nice. Although a little young.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/4197.html
Went shopping. Bought new street clothes. I like Hilfiger jeans. Don't understand the underwear in Victoria's Secret. Some of those things pinch. Should pick up lunch and stop by the Clocktower.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/3964.html

I am sore, and I am STILL tired, even though I seem to have slept for more than 14 hours. Alfred came to my cave, and set my hand. The whole hand is not broken. Just the thumb and index finger. Which is a relief. I can easily disguise that in a fight by using elbo thrusts and knife-hand thrusts. I do not want to talk about David Cain. I do not want to think about David Cain. He told me how "proud" I have made him. Stuff your pride in your ass, father. I don't do this for you. I do it for those who need it, and for my new family. He broke my finger and thumb stepping on my hand when I tried to take his feet from under him. I think it was to deter me from continuing the fight. So, I kicked out his knee. I know it broke. He's awaiting transfer somewhere...I'm not certain where...Santa Prisca, probably. I'm as sure that he'll never make it there as I am that Alfred will bring me another week's worth of dinners soon. Cain will escape. The Gotham Police aren't well-equipped enough to keep it from happening. I will.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/3716.html
Oracle: Crazies safe. My father stopped. Will file full report later. Too sore and tired. And typing w/ broken hand is difficult.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/3373.html

Am investigating crashed ambulance on corner of O'Neill and Breyfogle.

Wonder how it got turned over onto it's roof?
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/3229.html

Cain is in the city. Confirmed with my own eyes. I followed him as far as the Iceberg Lounge. I couldn't risk attempting a rooftop landing. He has informed us all of the Penguin's security including motion sensors on the rooftops.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/2834.html

Slept at the Clock Tower last night. The cave has seemed almost...foreboding. Not scary, exactly...it's my place, after all. But I didn't want to be alone, after finding the gift from Cain. Instead, I vented my feelings on the street. A minor criminal from Arkham Asylum attempted escape during transfer for a competency hearing. The first criminal Superman and Batman ever collaborated against. The Magpie. I don't see what the big deal was. She was a hopeless fighter, once I closed inside pistol range. Although I may have broken a finger deflecting a shovel-shot from one of her henchmen. That's proof positive that I'm being affected more by Cain than I would like.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/2672.html

There was a gift-box waiting for me on the rooftop I usually use for surveillance. I did not open it. There was every chance it might have contained an explosive of some kind. I took it back to His cave. Alfred helped me use the magnetic resonance imager. It was a dress. A black dress, in my size. There was a charm, a silver one, in the shape of the Mark of Cain. My dreams were not mere fear. My father IS in Gotham.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/2549.html

Uneventful in three of the cemetaries.

In the forth, the Maxfield Rest Community (Who names these places??), spotted a limousine at 3:47 a.m.

Could not get a clear view of the inhabitants.

Am transmitting the plate numbers and vehicle identification number for identification.

What does it mean when they have small flags of foreign countries affixed to the front of the vehicle, Oracle?
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/2275.html
*collapses into her chair in the cave, pulling off the cowl with one very shaky hand, revealing a shallow, bleeding wound on her head* *curls up in the chair, drawing her knees to her chest* Ow...
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/1950.html

My lack of restful sleep has begun to disturb my patrolling.

I was certain I saw my father tonight, two times.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/1788.html

I have dreamt of Cain every night this week.

When I wake, I feel old bruises, as if they were new.  I remembered a punishment, and woke with the sting of his hand still on my cheek.

I don't like dreaming about him.

It makes me very nervous.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/1369.html
I wonder if it is quite as cold and lonely in His cave at nights. I am used to silence. But it would be nicer to have another voice around more often. Perhaps I should get a cat.
http://cassandracain.livejournal.com/1214.html

Shoes for the wedding.
